text: By accounting for individual site conditions we confirm that load factors do decline with age, at a similar rate to other rotating machinery.
Wind turbines are found to lose 1.6 Â± 0.2% of their output per year, with average load factors declining from 28.5% when new to 21% at age 19.
This trend is consistent for different generations of turbine design and individual wind farms.
This level of degradation reduces a wind farm's output by 12% over a twenty year lifetime, increasing the levelised cost of electricity by 9%.
